symbols.docstring: - How do you create copies of your objects?
symbols.name: Why?

symbols.docstring: DeepCopy recursively traverses all the object's properties and clones them. To avoid cloning the same object twice it keeps a hash map of all instance
symbols.name: How it works

children.docstring: The `PropertyNameMatcher` will match a property by its name:
children.name: Property name

children.docstring: The `PropertyMatcher` will match a specific property of a specific class:
children.name: Specific property

children.docstring: The `TypeMatcher` will match any element by its type (instance of a class or any value that could be parameter of [gettype()](http://php.net/manual/en
children.name: Type

children.docstring: - `DeepCopy\Matcher` applies on a object attribute. - `DeepCopy\TypeMatcher` applies on any element found in graph, including array elements.
children.name: Matchers

children.docstring: Let's say for example that you are copying a database record (or a Doctrine entity), so you want the copy not to have any ID:
children.name: `SetNullFilter` (filter)

children.docstring: If you want a property to remain untouched (for example, an association to an object):
children.name: `KeepFilter` (filter)

children.docstring: If you use cloning on proxy classes, you might want to apply two filters for: 1. loading the data 2. applying a transformation
children.name: `ChainableFilter` (filter)

children.docstring: If you use Doctrine and want to copy an entity, you will need to use the `DoctrineCollectionFilter`:
children.name: `DoctrineCollectionFilter` (filter)

children.docstring: If you use Doctrine and want to copy an entity who contains a `Collection` that you want to be reset, you can use the `DoctrineEmptyCollectionFilter`
children.name: `DoctrineEmptyCollectionFilter` (filter)

children.docstring: If you use Doctrine and use cloning on lazy loaded entities, you might encounter errors mentioning missing fields on a Doctrine proxy class (...\\\_\_
children.name: `DoctrineProxyFilter` (filter)

children.docstring: 1. If you want to replace the value of a property:
children.name: `ReplaceFilter` (type filter)

children.docstring: Stop *DeepCopy* from recursively copying element, using standard `clone` instead:
children.name: `ShallowCopyFilter` (type filter)

children.docstring: - `DeepCopy\Filter` applies a transformation to the object attribute matched by `DeepCopy\Matcher` - `DeepCopy\TypeFilter` applies a transformation to
children.name: Filters

symbols.docstring: You can add filters to customize the copy process.
symbols.name: Going further

symbols.docstring: The following structures cannot be deep-copied with PHP Reflection. As a result they are shallow cloned and filters are not applied. There is two ways
symbols.name: Edge cases
